name: ATT&CK Layer
description: Layer showing techniques used by Lazarus group

techniques.comment: Lazarus exploited CVE-2021-44228 for remote access to public-facing servers.
The attackers exploited a vulnerability in the Log4j server software component.
Attackers used PowerShell to download and execute malicious payloads.
Attackers ran commands like 'whoami,' 'getmac,' and 'systeminfo' to gather information about the system.
'tasklist' command was used by the attackers to discover running processes.
Attackers used the WMIC command to discover antivirus software.
The attackers used the WMIC command to discover antivirus software on the system.
The 'netstat -nap tcp' command was used by attackers to scan network services.
The attackers created an additional user account on the system with administrative privileges.
A BAT script was used to setup persistence for the malware.
Lazarus used credential dumping utilities like ProcDump and MimiKatz.
The attackers used RAT tools for remote access and control, including a new RAT named 'NineRAT'.
The operation used Telegram for command and control.
